concepts.title: Input / Output
concepts.description: Read data and display results. In Node: use fetch, fs, and console.

concepts.title: Variables & Data Types
concepts.description: Use let/const. Primitives: number, string, boolean, bigint, symbol; objects and arrays.
concepts.code:
const answer = 42;             // number
let name = 'Ada';               // string
const ok = true;                // boolean
const items = [1, 2, 3];        // array
const user = { name, answer };  // object
console.log(typeof answer, typeof name, Array.isArray(items));

concepts.title: Functions / Procedures
concepts.description: Declare functions and arrow functions to reuse logic.

concepts.title: Libraries
concepts.description: Use npm to install packages; import ES modules.

concepts.title: Naming Conventions
concepts.description: camelCase for variables/functions, PascalCase for classes, UPPER_SNAKE_CASE for constants.
concepts.code:
const userName = 'ada';        // camelCase variable
function makeWidget() {}       // camelCase function
class HttpClient {}            // PascalCase class
const MAX_RETRIES = 3;         // UPPER_SNAKE_CASE constant

quick_start.title: Install Node.js
quick_start.description: Install via nvm or the official installer.
quick_start.code:
# macOS/Linux: nvm
curl -o- https://raw.githubusercontent.com/nvm-sh/nvm/v0.39.7/install.sh | bash
# restart shell then:
nvm install --lts
node -v && npm -v
